page.title: 13PARTRIDGE HILL FARM (1)
page.content: Partridge Hill Farm is owned by a{partnership of four men}who bought the farm fairly recently. The farm is situated 1 mile to the{east}of the {A638.}Its{230 acres}consist mainly of {arable}land, the main crops being wheat and barley which goes to the E.E.C.{Potatoes and sugar beet}are {also}grown-the potatoes are sold at the door and the sugar beet is sent to the British Sugar Corporation.The main factors which have infuenced the change of crops on this farm are,the {E.E.C,World prices}and to a lesser extent{soil type.}Dispite pressure from conservationist,{chemical sprays are still used.
